title: Roxy Jacenko and daughter Pixie wear matching $180 Cartel and Willow loungewear as she starts school
text:
Her daughter Pixie Curtis is already her mini-me after starting her own business Pixie Bows at the tender age of three.

And it seems that Roxy Jacenko's daughter is following in her mum's fashionable footsteps.

The mother and daughter duo were twinning on Tuesday when they wore matching nightwear for a photoshoot.

Twinning! Roxy Jacenko and daughter Pixie wear matching $180 loungewear during photoshoot for Cartel and Willow

Proud mum Roxy uploaded a cute snap of the pair, along with the caption 'Twinning with my Pix'.

The duo were dressed in a set of Cartel and Willow's latest jumper and night shorts, and were all smiles as they relished in mother and daughter time.

While Pixie went barefoot for the photos, her mum wore a $786 pair of Chanel PVC Slides.

Roxy later uploaded an adorable video of her growing and gap-toothed little girl reading one of her first school projects aloud.

'I wanted to say a big thank you for going to Skyzone with you mummy and I also love doing the photoshoot too mummy,' she said.



Family Time: Little brother Hunter joined in on the fun too

Pixie, who has her own verified Instagram account, posted another picture from the shoot with her brother joining in as well.

'Mummy and Me with Hunty too!' Roxy, who runs the account, captioned the post.

Roxy has had a lot to celebrate lately as she announced she was the ambassador for Australian coffee roaster Di Stefano on Monday.

The Sydney publicist-turned-entrepreneur showcased her extravagant $6million Vaucluse home she shares with husband, Oliver Curtis, in a new collaboration clip.

The advert follows the PR maven getting glammed by professional makeup artist Max May while showing off newly renovated bedroom which features a wall of designer handbags.

Their bedroom includes crystal lights, floor-to-ceiling windows, and a large walk in wardrobe.

After a quick glimpse of her daughter, Pixie, we then see the Roxy sharing a moment with her son Hunter Curtis while she works on her laptop.
description: Her daughter Pixie Curtis is already her mini-me after starting her own business, Pixie Bows, at the tender age of three.
authors: Tom Place For Daily Mail Australia
